result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey R Brocker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge= $543.00 plus court appointed attorney fees, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 12/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in an 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

10-09-2015 - The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $478.57

To commence FORTHWITH
--With Huber/ work release privileges

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.


The Court finds that Mr. Brocker has already submitted a DNA sample and does NOT need to provide another.

Case called at 10:26am [mo]
Defendant Corey R Brocker in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court strikes the Repeater enhancer 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Amended Charge; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel 
--the State submits Victim Impact Statement

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/ work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge= $543.00 plus court appointed attorney fees, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 12/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in an 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court finds that Mr. Brocker has already submitted a DNA sample and does NOT need to provide another. 
The Court notes that this pay plan includes Court Appointed Attorney fees and therefore any previously imposed order for payment is to be converted to this payment plan.
recess: 10:48am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 10:30 am

Case called at 8:36am [mo]
Defendant Corey R Brocker in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Humes requests a Plea and Sentencing date mid-September; indicates that Defense and Prosecution have had discussions and believes a settlement is near. Further, Atty. Humes indicates that if the case will not resolve as expected, then she will contact the Court's JA to schedule a FSSC and Jury Trial 
--no objection from ADA Hall

recess:8:42am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing: 9/14/2015 at 10:30am
Scheduling Notice
Status conference at 08-04-2015 08:30 am
State's with Cover Letter
Duplicate warrant returned-court ordered cancelled//warrant cancellation notice
Scheduling notice
Conflict review worksheet
Court ordered warrant cancelled due to appearance in court

Case called at 11:27am [mo]
Defendant Corey R Brocker in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ DOES NOT verify victim rights compliance; DA Happ indicates that the victim wished to be notified of all hearings and has not been notified due to the short notice of this hearing.
The Court will conduct only appearance on warrant, so that victim rights can be complied with
Atty. Humes indicates she is newly appointed to Mr. Brocker's case, gives case history
Atty. Humes indicates that the missed PreTrial Conference was a mis-understanding, Mr. Brocker thought he has already been appointed counsel and that he did not need to attend.
Atty. Humes requests that bond be reinstated as previously instated.
--No objection from DA Happ

The Court finds that the appearance of Mr. Brocker satisfied the warrant and should be removed from any database.
The Court notes the already scheduled Status Conference will remain as scheduled
Mr Brocker's bond and its conditions remain in effect.
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Brocker. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess: 11:37am 

NEXT: Status Conference: August 4, 2015 at 8:30am

Prior: 210 Applewood Ln, Watertown, WI 53094

Court orders warrant.

The Court appoints Attorney Humes//repayment order of $250 a month starting 07-10-2015

[MK] case called at 10:35am. 
Defendant Corey R Brocker in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Based on Mr. Brocker's voluntary appearance, the Court quashes the Warrant. 

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the $150 cash bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no contact with Dennis Gutzdorf,  Deborah Gutzdorf, or Samantha Harris
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses 
recess 10:39am
